channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Okla. AG seeks new trial for death row inmate, but Supreme Court seems split
item.description: At issue is whether the state court wrongly refused to accept the attorney general’s findings that a death row inmate is entitled to a new trial.
item.content:encoded:
At issue is whether the state court wrongly refused to accept the attorney general’s findings that a death row inmate is entitled to a new trial.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: On the frontline of Israel's invasion of Lebanon
item.description: Just over a week ago, the Israeli military sent ground troops into Lebanon to push the militant group Hezbollah back from the border. Our correspondent got as close a look at this invasion as possible, from a town ten miles from the border. He tells us what he saw.
item.content:encoded: Just over a week ago, the Israeli military sent ground troops into Lebanon to push the militant group Hezbollah back from the border. Our correspondent got as close a look at this invasion as possible, from a town ten miles from the border. He tells us what he saw.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Brown says no to pro-Palestinian students' demands for divestment
item.description: Supporters of divestment ended their encampment last spring in exchange for a promise that their proposal for divestment would get a vote from the board this fall.
item.content:encoded:
Supporters of divestment ended their encampment last spring in exchange for a promise that their proposal for divestment would get a vote from the board this fall.

(Image credit: Joseph Prezioso)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: Why Tampa Bay is at such high risk for hurricane damage
item.description: The area has not taken a direct hit from a hurricane in over 100 years. But its topography and dense population make it especially susceptible to severe damage from storm surges.
item.content:encoded:
The area has not taken a direct hit from a hurricane in over 100 years. But its topography and dense population make it especially susceptible to severe damage from storm surges.

(Image credit: Bryan R. Smith)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Keep calm and hunker down: Floridians brace for Hurricane Milton's impact
item.description: In spite of the very real threat to their homes, belongings and livelihoods, many Floridians in Milton's potential path remained in good spirits hours before its expected landfall.
item.content:encoded:
In spite of the very real threat to their homes, belongings and livelihoods, many Floridians in Milton's potential path remained in good spirits hours before its expected landfall.

(Image credit: Marta Lavandier)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Lynx, tiger and tadpoles, oh my: See the Wildlife Photographer of the Year winners
item.description: A lynx stretching in the sun, tadpoles swimming beneath lily pads and an investigator dusting a tusk for prints are among the winning images from the newest Wildlife Photographer of the Year awards.
item.content:encoded:
A lynx stretching in the sun, tadpoles swimming beneath lily pads and an investigator dusting a tusk for prints are among the winning images from the newest Wildlife Photographer of the Year awards.

(Image credit: Shane Gross)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Implosion brings down Tropicana casino in Vegas to make way for baseball stadium
item.description: The Tropicana, the third-oldest casino on the Las Vegas Strip, closed in April after welcoming guests for 67 years. An elaborate implosion reduced it to rubble on Wednesday.
item.content:encoded:
The Tropicana, the third-oldest casino on the Las Vegas Strip, closed in April after welcoming guests for 67 years. An elaborate implosion reduced it to rubble on Wednesday.

(Image credit: David Becker)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Honda recalls nearly 1.7M vehicles for steering problem that could lead to crashes
item.description: The vehicles covered in the recall were from model years 2022 to 2025 and include certain Acura Integras, Honda Civics, Honda CR-Vs and Honda HR-Vs.
item.content:encoded:
The vehicles covered in the recall were from model years 2022 to 2025 and include certain Acura Integras, Honda Civics, Honda CR-Vs and Honda HR-Vs.

(Image credit: Kyodo News)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A bidding war is brewing for Alex Jones’ media empire
item.description: Infowars is on the auction block, and would-be-buyers have opposite agendas.
item.content:encoded:
Infowars is on the auction block, and would-be-buyers have opposite agendas.

(Image credit: David J. Phillip)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: How FEMA tries to combat rumors and conspiracy theories about Milton and Helene
item.description: The emergency management agency has long tried to respond to rumors that might delay recovery efforts. But a former FEMA official says the current information environment has never been so bad.
item.content:encoded:
The emergency management agency has long tried to respond to rumors that might delay recovery efforts. But a former FEMA official says the current information environment has never been so bad.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Huo Jingnan
